content.heading: Strings - Special Characters
paragraphs:
Because strings must be written within quotes, C++ will misunderstand this string, 
and generate an error:
The solution to avoid this problem, is to use the backslash escape character.
The backslash (\) escape character turns special characters into string characters:
The sequence \"  inserts a double quote in a string:
The sequence \'  inserts a single quote in a string:
The sequence \\  inserts a single backslash in a string:
Other popular escape characters in C++ are:

content.heading: Example
paragraphs: string txt = "We are the so-called \"Vikings\" from the north." ;
